body.p: Mr. Charles Dickens will be punctual in his attendance on the mournful occasionDr William Brown, husband of Miss Coutts’s companion, Hannah (née Meredith), had died suddenly, 23 Oct, when at Montpellier with Miss Coutts and his wife. CD, then staying in Paris, undertook the arrangements for Dr Brown’s burial at St Stephen’s, Rochester Row (7 Nov), returning to London for the purpose (Pilgrim Letters 7, pp. 727-35 & nn). CD’s is a formal response to the firm after formal notification. to which the letter of Messrs. Banting and Sons refers.
